xxl.core.math.numerics.splines

Class RB2CubicBezierSpline

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.functions.AbstractFunction<Number,Double>
      • xxl.core.math.functions.AbstractRealFunctionFunction
        • xxl.core.math.numerics.splines.CubicBezierSpline
          • xxl.core.math.numerics.splines.RB2CubicBezierSpline
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Function<Number,Double>, RealFunction

    public class RB2CubicBezierSpline
extends CubicBezierSpline
    This class implements a cubic Bezier-Spline with the second boundary condition. Thus, the abstract class CubicBezierSpline is implemented. Since there are most of the variables precomputed, this class only implements the method solveLGS. This method solves a linear equation system whose solution uniquely determines the Bezier-coefficients. For solving the linear equation system, a modified version of the Gauss algorithm is used because the system contains a tridiagonal matrix and this permits an efficient computation.
    See Also:
    CubicBezierSpline, RB1CubicBezierSpline, Maths.triDiagonalGaussianLGS(double[],double[],double[],double[]), Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RB2CubicBezierSpline

        public RB2CubicBezierSpline(double[] grid,
                            double[] fvalues,
                            double deviation_0,
                            double deviation_dim,
                            boolean cdfMode)
        Constructs a cubic Bezier-Spline with the second boundary condition based upon a grid and the corresponding function values. Also the values of the second derivative at the borders are given. A flag cdfMode indicates whether the spline is in cdf mode or not, i.e., evaluating the spline at x > maximum causes the spline to return 1.0 instead of 0.0.
        Parameters:
        grid - given grid points
        fvalues - function values at the grid points
        deviation_0 - value of the first derivative of f at the left border of the grid
        deviation_dim - value of the first derivative of f at the right border of the grid
        cdfMode - indicates spline is in cdf mode

      • RB2CubicBezierSpline

        public RB2CubicBezierSpline(double a,
                            double b,
                            int n,
                            double[] fvalues,
                            double deviation_0,
                            double deviation_dim,
                            boolean cdfMode)
        Constructs a cubic Bezier-Spline with the second boundary condition based upon an equidistant grid and the corresponding function values. Also the values of the second derivative at the borders are given. A flag cdfMode indicates whether the spline is in cdf Mode or not, i.e., evaluating the spline at x > maximum causes the spline to return 1.0 instead of 0.0.
        Parameters:
        a - left border of the grid
        b - right border of the grid
        n - number of grid points
        fvalues - function values at the grid points
        deviation_0 - value of the first derivative of f at the left border of the grid
        deviation_dim - value of the first derivative of f at the right border of the grid
        cdfMode - indicates spline is in cdf mode

      • RB2CubicBezierSpline

        public RB2CubicBezierSpline(double[] grid,
                            double[] fvalues,
                            double deviation_0,
                            double deviation_dim)
        Constructs a cubic Bezier-Spline with the second boundary condition based upon a grid and the corresponding function values. Also the values of the second derivative at the borders are given. Initially, the cdf mode is set to false.
        Parameters:
        grid - given grid points
        fvalues - function values at the grid points
        deviation_0 - value of the first derivative of f at the left border of the grid
        deviation_dim - value of the first derivative of f at the right border of the grid

                            double b,
                            int n,
                            double[] fvalues,
                            double deviation_0,
                            double deviation_dim)
        Constructs a cubic Bezier-Spline with the second boundary condition based upon an equidistant grid and the corresponding function values. Also the values of the second derivative at the borders are given. Initially, the cdf mode is set to false.
        Parameters:
        a - left border of the grid
        b - right border of the grid
        n - number of grid points
        fvalues - function values at the grid points
        deviation_0 - value of the first derivative of f at the left border of the grid
        deviation_dim - value of the first derivative of f at the right border of the grid
